in.description: The location of the API key. Valid values are "query", "header", or "cookie".

name.description: The name of the header, query or cookie parameter to be used.

AgentCapabilities.description: Defines optional capabilities supported by an agent.

pushNotifications.description: true if the agent can notify updates to client.

stateTransitionHistory.description: true if the agent exposes status change history for tasks.

streaming.description: true if the agent supports SSE.

AgentCard.description:
An AgentCard conveys key information:
- Overall details (version, name, description, uses)
- Skills: A set of capabilities the agent can perform
- Default modalities/content types supported by the agent.
- Authentication requirements

capabilities.description: Optional capabilities supported by the agent.

defaultInputModes.description:
The set of interaction modes that the agent supports across all skills. This can be overridden per-skill.
Supported mime types for input.

description.description:
A human-readable description of the agent. Used to assist users and
other agents in understanding what the agent can do.

documentationUrl.description: A URL to documentation for the agent.

iconUrl.description: A URL to an icon for the agent.

name.description: Human readable name of the agent.

provider.description: The service provider of the agent

security.description: Security requirements for contacting the agent.

securitySchemes.description: Security scheme details used for authenticating with this agent.

skills.description: Skills are a unit of capability that an agent can perform.

supportsAuthenticatedExtendedCard.description:
true if the agent supports providing an extended agent card when the user is authenticated.
Defaults to false if not specified.

url.description: A URL to the address the agent is hosted at.

version.description: The version of the agent - format is up to the provider.

AgentProvider.description: Represents the service provider of an agent.

AgentSkill.description: Represents a unit of capability that an agent can perform.

description.description:
Description of the skill - will be used by the client or a human
as a hint to understand what the skill does.

examples.description:
The set of example scenarios that the skill can perform.
Will be used by the client as a hint to understand how the skill can be used.

id.description: Unique identifier for the agent's skill.

inputModes.description:
The set of interaction modes that the skill supports
(if different than the default).
Supported mime types for input.

name.description: Human readable name of the skill.

tags.description: Set of tagwords describing classes of capabilities for this specific skill.

Artifact.description: Represents an artifact generated for a task.

AuthorizationCodeOAuthFlow.description: Configuration details for a supported OAuth Flow

authorizationUrl.description:
The authorization URL to be used for this flow. This MUST be in the form of a URL. The OAuth2
standard requires the use of TLS

refreshUrl.description:
The URL to be used for obtaining refresh tokens. This MUST be in the form of a URL. The OAuth2
standard requires the use of TLS.

scopes.description:
The available scopes for the OAuth2 security scheme. A map between the scope name and a short
description for it. The map MAY be empty.

tokenUrl.description:
The token URL to be used for this flow. This MUST be in the form of a URL. The OAuth2 standard
requires the use of TLS.

CancelTaskRequest.description: JSON-RPC request model for the 'tasks/cancel' method.

id.description:
An identifier established by the Client that MUST contain a String, Number.
Numbers SHOULD NOT contain fractional parts.

jsonrpc.description: Specifies the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. MUST be exactly "2.0".

method.description: A String containing the name of the method to be invoked.

params.description: A Structured value that holds the parameter values to be used during the invocation of the method.

CancelTaskSuccessResponse.description: JSON-RPC success response model for the 'tasks/cancel' method.

id.description:
An identifier established by the Client that MUST contain a String, Number.
Numbers SHOULD NOT contain fractional parts.

jsonrpc.description: Specifies the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. MUST be exactly "2.0".

ClientCredentialsOAuthFlow.description: Configuration details for a supported OAuth Flow

refreshUrl.description:
The URL to be used for obtaining refresh tokens. This MUST be in the form of a URL. The OAuth2
standard requires the use of TLS.

scopes.description:
The available scopes for the OAuth2 security scheme. A map between the scope name and a short
description for it. The map MAY be empty.

tokenUrl.description:
The token URL to be used for this flow. This MUST be in the form of a URL. The OAuth2 standard
requires the use of TLS.

ContentTypeNotSupportedError.description: A2A specific error indicating incompatible content types between request and agent capabilities.

code.description: A Number that indicates the error type that occurred.

data.description:
A Primitive or Structured value that contains additional information about the error.
This may be omitted.

message.description: A String providing a short description of the error.

DataPart.description: Represents a structured data segment within a message part.

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the part.

FileBase.description: Represents the base entity for FileParts

FilePart.description: Represents a File segment within parts.

file.description: File content either as url or bytes

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the part.

FileWithBytes.description: Define the variant where 'bytes' is present and 'uri' is absent

bytes.description: base64 encoded content of the file

FileWithUri.description: Define the variant where 'uri' is present and 'bytes' is absent

GetTaskPushNotificationConfigRequest.description: JSON-RPC request model for the 'tasks/pushNotificationConfig/get' method.

id.description:
An identifier established by the Client that MUST contain a String, Number.
Numbers SHOULD NOT contain fractional parts.

jsonrpc.description: Specifies the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. MUST be exactly "2.0".

method.description: A String containing the name of the method to be invoked.

params.description: A Structured value that holds the parameter values to be used during the invocation of the method.

GetTaskPushNotificationConfigSuccessResp.description: JSON-RPC success response model for the 'tasks/pushNotificationConfig/get' method.

id.description:
An identifier established by the Client that MUST contain a String, Number.
Numbers SHOULD NOT contain fractional parts.

jsonrpc.description: Specifies the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. MUST be exactly "2.0".

GetTaskRequest.description: JSON-RPC request model for the 'tasks/get' method.

id.description:
An identifier established by the Client that MUST contain a String, Number.
Numbers SHOULD NOT contain fractional parts.

jsonrpc.description: Specifies the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. MUST be exactly "2.0".

method.description: A String containing the name of the method to be invoked.

params.description: A Structured value that holds the parameter values to be used during the invocation of the method.

GetTaskSuccessResponse.description: JSON-RPC success response for the 'tasks/get' method.

id.description:
An identifier established by the Client that MUST contain a String, Number.
Numbers SHOULD NOT contain fractional parts.

jsonrpc.description: Specifies the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. MUST be exactly "2.0".

bearerFormat.description:
A hint to the client to identify how the bearer token is formatted. Bearer tokens are usually
generated by an authorization server, so this information is primarily for documentation
purposes.

scheme.description:
The name of the HTTP Authentication scheme to be used in the Authorization header as defined
in RFC7235. The values used SHOULD be registered in the IANA Authentication Scheme registry.
The value is case-insensitive, as defined in RFC7235.

ImplicitOAuthFlow.description: Configuration details for a supported OAuth Flow

authorizationUrl.description:
The authorization URL to be used for this flow. This MUST be in the form of a URL. The OAuth2
standard requires the use of TLS

refreshUrl.description:
The URL to be used for obtaining refresh tokens. This MUST be in the form of a URL. The OAuth2
standard requires the use of TLS.

scopes.description:
The available scopes for the OAuth2 security scheme. A map between the scope name and a short
description for it. The map MAY be empty.

InternalError.description: JSON-RPC error indicating an internal JSON-RPC error on the server.

code.description: A Number that indicates the error type that occurred.

data.description:
A Primitive or Structured value that contains additional information about the error.
This may be omitted.

message.description: A String providing a short description of the error.

InvalidAgentResponseError.description: A2A specific error indicating agent returned invalid response for the current method

code.description: A Number that indicates the error type that occurred.

data.description:
A Primitive or Structured value that contains additional information about the error.
This may be omitted.

message.description: A String providing a short description of the error.

InvalidParamsError.description: JSON-RPC error indicating invalid method parameter(s).

code.description: A Number that indicates the error type that occurred.

data.description:
A Primitive or Structured value that contains additional information about the error.
This may be omitted.

message.description: A String providing a short description of the error.

InvalidRequestError.description: JSON-RPC error indicating the JSON sent is not a valid Request object.

code.description: A Number that indicates the error type that occurred.

data.description:
A Primitive or Structured value that contains additional information about the error.
This may be omitted.

message.description: A String providing a short description of the error.

JSONParseError.description: JSON-RPC error indicating invalid JSON was received by the server.

code.description: A Number that indicates the error type that occurred.

data.description:
A Primitive or Structured value that contains additional information about the error.
This may be omitted.

message.description: A String providing a short description of the error.

JSONRPCError.description:
Represents a JSON-RPC 2.0 Error object.
This is typically included in a JSONRPCErrorResponse when an error occurs.

code.description: A Number that indicates the error type that occurred.

data.description:
A Primitive or Structured value that contains additional information about the error.
This may be omitted.

message.description: A String providing a short description of the error.

JSONRPCErrorResponse.description: Represents a JSON-RPC 2.0 Error Response object.

id.description:
An identifier established by the Client that MUST contain a String, Number.
Numbers SHOULD NOT contain fractional parts.

jsonrpc.description: Specifies the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. MUST be exactly "2.0".

JSONRPCMessage.description: Base interface for any JSON-RPC 2.0 request or response.

id.description:
An identifier established by the Client that MUST contain a String, Number.
Numbers SHOULD NOT contain fractional parts.

jsonrpc.description: Specifies the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. MUST be exactly "2.0".

id.description:
An identifier established by the Client that MUST contain a String, Number.
Numbers SHOULD NOT contain fractional parts.

jsonrpc.description: Specifies the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. MUST be exactly "2.0".

method.description: A String containing the name of the method to be invoked.

params.description: A Structured value that holds the parameter values to be used during the invocation of the method.

JSONRPCSuccessResponse.description: Represents a JSON-RPC 2.0 Success Response object.

id.description:
An identifier established by the Client that MUST contain a String, Number.
Numbers SHOULD NOT contain fractional parts.

jsonrpc.description: Specifies the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. MUST be exactly "2.0".

Message.description: Represents a single message exchanged between user and agent.

contextId.description: The context the message is associated with

messageId.description: Identifier created by the message creator

referenceTaskIds.description: List of tasks referenced as context by this message.

taskId.description: Identifier of task the message is related to

MessageSendConfiguration.description: Configuration for the send message request.

acceptedOutputModes.description: Accepted output modalities by the client.

blocking.description: If the server should treat the client as a blocking request.

historyLength.description: Number of recent messages to be retrieved.

pushNotificationConfig.description: Where the server should send notifications when disconnected.

MessageSendParams.description: Sent by the client to the agent as a request. May create, continue or restart a task.

message.description: The message being sent to the server.

MethodNotFoundError.description: JSON-RPC error indicating the method does not exist or is not available.

code.description: A Number that indicates the error type that occurred.

data.description:
A Primitive or Structured value that contains additional information about the error.
This may be omitted.

message.description: A String providing a short description of the error.

flows.description: An object containing configuration information for the flow types supported.

OAuthFlows.description: Allows configuration of the supported OAuth Flows

authorizationCode.description: Configuration for the OAuth Authorization Code flow. Previously called accessCode in OpenAPI 2.0.

clientCredentials.description: Configuration for the OAuth Client Credentials flow. Previously called application in OpenAPI 2.0

implicit.description: Configuration for the OAuth Implicit flow

password.description: Configuration for the OAuth Resource Owner Password flow

openIdConnectUrl.description: Well-known URL to discover the [[OpenID-Connect-Discovery]] provider metadata.

Part.description: Represents a part of a message, which can be text, a file, or structured data.

PartBase.description: Base properties common to all message parts.

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the part.

PasswordOAuthFlow.description: Configuration details for a supported OAuth Flow

refreshUrl.description:
The URL to be used for obtaining refresh tokens. This MUST be in the form of a URL. The OAuth2
standard requires the use of TLS.

scopes.description:
The available scopes for the OAuth2 security scheme. A map between the scope name and a short
description for it. The map MAY be empty.

tokenUrl.description:
The token URL to be used for this flow. This MUST be in the form of a URL. The OAuth2 standard
requires the use of TLS.

PushNotificationAuthenticationInfo.description: Defines authentication details for push notifications.

schemes.description: Supported authentication schemes - e.g. Basic, Bearer

PushNotificationConfig.description: Configuration for setting up push notifications for task updates.

url.description: URL for sending the push notifications.

PushNotificationNotSupportedError.description: A2A specific error indicating the agent does not support push notifications.

code.description: A Number that indicates the error type that occurred.

data.description:
A Primitive or Structured value that contains additional information about the error.
This may be omitted.

message.description: A String providing a short description of the error.

SecurityScheme.description:
Mirrors the OpenAPI Security Scheme Object
(https://swagger.io/specification/#security-scheme-object)

SecuritySchemeBase.description: Base properties shared by all security schemes.

An identifier established by the Client that MUST contain a String, Number.
Numbers SHOULD NOT contain fractional parts.

jsonrpc.description: Specifies the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. MUST be exactly "2.0".

params.description: A Structured value that holds the parameter values to be used during the invocation of the method.

An identifier established by the Client that MUST contain a String, Number.
Numbers SHOULD NOT contain fractional parts.

artifacts.description: Collection of artifacts created by the agent.

contextId.description: Server-generated id for contextual alignment across interactions

id.description: Unique identifier for the task

TaskArtifactUpdateEvent.description: Sent by server during sendStream or subscribe requests

append.description: Indicates if this artifact appends to a previous one

contextId.description: The context the task is associated with

lastChunk.description: Indicates if this is the last chunk of the artifact

TaskIdParams.description: Parameters containing only a task ID, used for simple task operations.

id.description: Task id.

TaskNotCancelableError.description: A2A specific error indicating the task is in a state where it cannot be canceled.

code.description: A Number that indicates the error type that occurred.

data.description:
A Primitive or Structured value that contains additional information about the error.
This may be omitted.

message.description: A String providing a short description of the error.

TaskNotFoundError.description: A2A specific error indicating the requested task ID was not found.

code.description: A Number that indicates the error type that occurred.

data.description:
A Primitive or Structured value that contains additional information about the error.
This may be omitted.

message.description: A String providing a short description of the error.

TaskPushNotificationConfig.description: Parameters for setting or getting push notification configuration for a task

TaskQueryParams.description: Parameters for querying a task, including optional history length.

historyLength.description: Number of recent messages to be retrieved.

id.description: Task id.

TaskResubscriptionRequest.description: JSON-RPC request model for the 'tasks/resubscribe' method.

id.description:
An identifier established by the Client that MUST contain a String, Number.
Numbers SHOULD NOT contain fractional parts.

jsonrpc.description: Specifies the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. MUST be exactly "2.0".

method.description: A String containing the name of the method to be invoked.

params.description: A Structured value that holds the parameter values to be used during the invocation of the method.

TaskState.description: Represents the possible states of a Task.

timestamp.description: ISO 8601 datetime string when the status was recorded.

TaskStatusUpdateEvent.description: Sent by server during sendStream or subscribe requests

contextId.description: The context the task is associated with

final.description: Indicates the end of the event stream

TextPart.description: Represents a text segment within parts.

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the part.

UnsupportedOperationError.description: A2A specific error indicating the requested operation is not supported by the agent.

code.description: A Number that indicates the error type that occurred.

data.description:
A Primitive or Structured value that contains additional information about the error.
This may be omitted.

message.description: A String providing a short description of the error.
